summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York leading up to and following the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It records his activities, the discovery of his body, medical response, notifications to authorities, and the subsequent investigation and evidence collection.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019, and did not return to the institution.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge presiding over Epstein's case who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

connections.description: Reyes is explicitly identified as Epstein's cellmate in the SHU.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences and is reported to be in good spirits during a social call in the evening.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, staff find Epstein unresponsive in his SHU cell. CPR is initiated, EMS is called, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital where he is pronounced dead at 7:36 am.

events.title: Notifications and Investigation Initiated
events.description: Multiple agencies are notified including the USMS, FBI, AUSA, OIG, and Judge Berman. The FBI and OIG arrive at the MCC to investigate. Epstein's next of kin (brother) is notified.

events.title: Evidence Collection
events.description: Epstein's fingerprints and photographs are taken at the hospital, and his clothing is secured. Later that night, a Computer Services Manager arrives to remove and replace hard drives from computers in the SHU.

events.title: OIG Removes Evidence
events.description: An OIG Agent departs the institution with two computers (FPS 021407270 and FPS 0214207268) that were removed from the SHU.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his SHU cell at the MCC New York at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
Epstein was pronounced dead at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019, after extensive resuscitation efforts failed.
Epstein's cellmate, inmate Reyes, had departed for court on August 9 and did not return to the institution prior to the incident.
On the night of August 10, a Computer Services Manager removed hard drives from computers in the SHU and replaced them with new ones.
The FBI and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) were notified and arrived on-site to investigate the incident on August 10.
